jchrest.domainSpecifics.chess.fixations

Class GlobalStrategyFixation

  • java.lang.Object
    • jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation
      • jchrest.domainSpecifics.chess.fixations.GlobalStrategyFixation

  • public class GlobalStrategyFixation
extends Fixation
    Represents a "global" strategy in chess (see the "Global strategies" fixation heuristic description in section 8.7.6 of "Perception and Memory in Chess" by de Groot and Gobet). NOTE: GlobalStrategyFixations require a Fixation focused on a Square containing a non-blind SceneObject to have been added by the Perceiver associated with the Chrest model that invokes #this#make(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int) prior to this invocation in order to propose a Square to fixate on.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation

      Square make(Scene scene, int time)
      This method should not be invoked directly to make #this since it will not be guaranteed that the instance variables of #this pertaining to its performance will be set by the concrete implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GlobalStrategyFixation

        public GlobalStrategyFixation(Chrest model,
                              int timeThatDecidingUponThisStarts,
                              int timeTakenToDecideUponThis)
        Parameters:
        model -
        timeThatDecidingUponThisStarts - The time (in milliseconds) that it will be in the domain when #this starts to be decided upon.
        timeTakenToDecideUponThis - The time (in milliseconds) that it takes to decide upon the Square that #this will fixate on after starting deliberation on it.

    • Method Detail

      • make

        public Square make(Scene scene,
                   int time)
        Description copied from class: Fixation
        This method should not be invoked directly to make #this since it will not be guaranteed that the instance variables of #this pertaining to its performance will be set by the concrete implementation. Neither can it be guaranteed that the jchrest.lib.Scene that #this is made in context of is the jchrest.lib.Scene that previous Fixations in the same set have been made in context of. Use #this#perform(jchrest.lib.Scene, int) instead.
        Specified by:
        make in class Fixation
        Parameters:
        time -
        scene - The jchrest.lib.Scene that #this is to be made in context of.
        Returns:
        Either a Square on a quadrant of the scene that has not yet been fixated on in context of the current set of Fixations being made by the Chrest model invoking this function or null if any of the following statements evaluate to Boolean.TRUE:
        • The result of #this#getPerformanceTime() is greater than the time specified.
        • The result of invoking Scene.isBlind() on the scene specified returns Boolean.TRUE.
        • The result of invoking Object.getClass() on the scene specified causes Object.equals( java.lang.Object) to return Boolean.FALSE when compared against ChessBoard.
        • The result of invoking Perceiver.getFixationsPerformed(int) in context of the Perceiver associated with the Chrest model invoking this function and the time specified returns null or an empty List
        • No suitable Square can be found.
        The "quadrant checking" mentioned above works by calculating if the white-side, black-side, queen-side and king-side of the ChessBoard represented by the scene specified have been fixated on yet. If any quadrant has not been, all Squares within the quadrant are added to a List and a Square is selected at random from this List.
